Instead he said, as casually as he could, "Their son -- he'd be about Dudley's age now, wouldn't he?"

He teaches Potions, but he doesn't want to -- everyone knows he's after Quirrell's job.
The class everyone had really been looking forward to was Defense Against the Dark Arts, but Quirrell's lessons turned out to be a bit of a joke.

He was ripping the paper off a gold wristwatch when Aunt Petunia came back from the telephone looking both angry and worried.

Horror-struck, Harry waved madly at the other three to follow him as quickly as possible; they scurried silently toward the door, away from Filch's voice.

Sorcerer.name: Sorcerer
sample_contexts: "Nicolas Flamel," she whispered dramatically, "is the only known maker of the Sorcerer's Stone!"
She pushed the book toward them, and Harry and Ron read: The ancient study of alchemy is concerned with making the Sorcerer's Stone, a legendary substance with astonishing powers.
There have been many reports of the Sorcerer's Stone over the centuries, but the only Stone currently in existence belongs to Mr. Nicolas Flamel, the noted alchemist and opera lover.

King.name: King

"Er -- I need to be at King's Cross tomorrow to -- to go to Hogwarts."

Flamel.name: Flamel

He had been wondering for a while if Flamel wasn't somewhere in there.
He'd be able to read as long as he liked, as long as it took to find out who Flamel was.

Stone.name: Stone
sample_contexts: "So you mean the Stone's only safe as long as Quirrell stands up to Snape?" said Hermione in alarm.
Snape was sweeping about in his usual bad temper, which surely meant that the Stone was still safe.
"Harry, relax, Hermione's right, the Stone's safe as long as Dumbledore's around.

Lee Jordan was finding it difficult not to take sides.
